Material used.Description: This study compared mitochondria prepared from differentiated SH-SY5Y cells overexpressing WT or A53T α-syn with control cells.

Readout description.Result Description: Of the 71 protein spots found to be differentially expressed, 63 proteins were identified by LC - MS/MS, with the majority (77%) significantly altered in WT samples only. The dendrograms showed that the majority of the differential significant changes in protein expression levels arose from alterations in the WT α-syn cells rather than the A53T α-syn SH - SY5Y cells.

Biological replicates.Description: 4 replicates each of control, A53T and WT groups in the pH 4 - 7 range and 3 replicates from each of the same three groups in the pH 6 - 11 range.

Basic positive control.Description: WT should be used as the basic positive control, so 'Basic positive control': 'Yes'

Basic negative control.Description: Control cells (host cells) were used as the basic negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA (p < 0.01; Host:WT:A53T) and subsequently using independent t tests (host vs WT, host vs A53T)

Material used.Description: Altered levels of four mitochondrial proteins (HSPA9 (mortalin), NDUFS1, DLAT, ATP5A1) were confirmed using Western blot analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Four proteins showed similar direction of change in expression levels to that observed in the 2D study. HSPA9 and NDUFS1 showed decreased expression in WT group, DLAT showed decreased expression in WT group, and ATP5A1 showed increased expression in WT group.

Biological replicates.Description: Three consecutive passages of cell extracts were run in parallel for each sample type.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: WT should be used as the basic positive control, so 'Basic positive control': 'Yes'

Basic negative control.Description: Control cells (host cells) were used as the basic negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Optical density values were calculated as a percentage of the mean signal generated by control cells. Data was presented as a percentage of the mean control group.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: OXPHOS Complex I Quantity and Activity Analysis

Material used.Description: Mitochondria were prepared from triplicate passages of each cell type to evaluate OXPHOS complex I enzyme activity and quantity.

Readout description.Result Description: A significant reduction in OXPHOS Complex I activity was observed in the WT α-syn cells. The A53T overexpressing cell lines showed no significant change in OXPHOS Complex I activity compared to host cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Mitochondria were prepared from triplicate passages of each cell type.

Basic positive control.Description: WT should be used as the basic positive control, so 'Basic positive control': 'Yes'

Basic negative control.Description: Control cells (host cells) were used as the basic negative control.
